Package game.behaviour

Class CarniHungerBehaviour

java.lang.Object
game.behaviour.CarniHungerBehaviour
All Implemented Interfaces:
Behaviour, HungerBehaviour
public class CarniHungerBehaviour
extends java.lang.Object
implements HungerBehaviour
Class that decides whether a carnivore is hungry and finds food if so
Since:
03/05/2021
Author:
Lin Chen Xiang
See Also:
Behaviour, Actor, Action, Location, HungerBehaviour, Dinosaur, CarnivoreDinosaur, DinosaurStatus, ItemStats, EatPreyAction, EatItemAction, FollowBehaviour, GoToLocation, GameMap

    Action findFood​(Location here, Actor dinosaur, GameMap map)
    Finds the closest prey or carnivore food source in the map and start moving towards it.
    Action getAction​(Actor actor, GameMap map)
    Checks all exits whether there is food and eat it immediately if so, Otherwise scan through entire map and find the closest food source and start moving towards it.

  • Method Details

    • getAction

      public Action getAction​(Actor actor, GameMap map)
      Checks all exits whether there is food and eat it immediately if so, Otherwise scan through entire map and find the closest food source and start moving towards it.
      Specified by:
      getAction in interface Behaviour
      Parameters:
      actor - the Actor acting
      map - the GameMap containing the Actor
      Returns:
      null if no food source found, or Action to be done if found food
      See Also:
      Actor.playTurn(Actions, Action, GameMap, Display)

    • findFood

      public Action findFood​(Location here, Actor dinosaur, GameMap map)
      Finds the closest prey or carnivore food source in the map and start moving towards it.
      Specified by:
      findFood in interface HungerBehaviour
      Parameters:
      here - location of this actor
      dinosaur - the actor looking for food
      map - World map
      Returns:
      null if no food found, or Action to start moving towards food

    • distance

      private int distance​(Location a, Location b)
      Compute the Manhattan distance between two locations.
      Parameters:
      a - the first location
      b - the first location
      Returns:
      the number of steps between a and b if you only move in the four cardinal directions.
